DataElement.preferredName: Non Cancer Tissue Excision To Freezing Time Duration Range
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the amount of time in minutes between the removal of the submitted tissue from the patient, to the time it was frozen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non Cancer Tissue Excision To Freezing Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. :Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
